results.title: Carry on Dick
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 26th ‘Carry on’ film is one of mistaken identities and secret lives. Highwayman Dick Turpin - Big Dick (Sid James), is also the town rector, ably supported by Harry and Tom (Barbara Windsor and Peter Butterworth) - his parlour maid and the man who pumps the church’s organ. There is only one weak link in the chain - a noticeable birthmark on Turpin’s privates which will require the assistance of a bevy of busty women to bring to light. The charge will be led by Captain Fancy and Jock Strap. Cast also includes Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Bernard Bresslaw and Joan Sims.

results.title: Carry on up the Khyber
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Peter Rogers Productions and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
It is 1895 and the British occupation of India is threatened by revolutionary uprisings. In order for the revolutionaries to attack the British troops they need to cross the notorious Khyber Pass. The history and politics of the British Raj, however, is simply a convenient background for the Carry On team to conduct their regular mix of hilarious slap-stick and tongue-in-cheek camp. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and a large supporting cast of British comedians.

results.title: Carry on abroad: or, what a package: or, it's all in: or, Swiss hols in the snow
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 23rd “Carry on” film finds a gang of prim and proper British tourists on a disastrous holiday. This is despite the reassuring name of the tour organisers and their location - Wundatours on a package tour of the Paradise island of Elsbels on the Costa Plonka. Their dreams of a luxury hotel quickly disintegrate when they discover the hotel is still being built, there’s faulty wiring, a leaky roof, all staff look suspiciously alike and there’s a disgruntled cook. Add to this the usual carry on shenanigans surrounding beds and showers and we are in for a holiday like no other. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw, Barbara Windsor, Kenneth Connor and Hattie Jacques.

results.title: Carry on doctor
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethescopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.

results.title: Time watch
results.brief_description: Timewatch is the BBC’s flagship documentary history series that has been recognised with a string of prestigious awards, including three Emmys.
results.description: Timewatch is the BBC’s flagship documentary history series that has been recognised with a string of prestigious awards, including three Emmys.

group_works.title: A Cold war
group_works.creator_credit: Jonathan Dent, Lionheart TV International and BBC

results.title: Haig: the unknown soldier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Scottish field Marshall Sir Douglas Haig is infamous for being known as the man responsible for sending 723,000 British soldiers to their deaths - carnage on an unheard of scale. Inarticulate and stubborn, Haig was accused of being callous and incompetent, the “Butcher of the Somme,” the donkey in charge of the British army of lions. Lampooned and caricatured in the media - print then, television now (BlackAdder). Research by military historians into the performance of the British Army in World War 1 queries the myth of Haig as a buffoon in his position as British Commander in Chief on the Western Front, a post he assumed in December 1915. The program postulates that casualties were high given that it was a war of industrial powers and all that this entailed on a military scale. Provides brief biographical information, readings from Haig’s diary, interviews with historians and veterans and archival footage.

group_siblings.title: The African trade
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jonathan Lewis and BBC

results.title: The African trade
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Between the sixteenth and nineteenth century, 12,000 million Africans were sold as slave labour. The sheer number of people made it the biggest example of forced migration. Accompanying a tour of African Americans tracing their painful past, this documentary postulates that the Trans-Atlantic slave trade was only made possible by the existence of a prolific slave trade already in Africa. This resulted in the formation of mutually beneficial partnerships between Europeans and Africans. Europe and America would benefit in the long term from the arrangement, but West Africa would be left with little, only a guilt which is often not acknowledged. Narrated by Josette Simon.

results.title: A Cold war
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Dent, Lionheart TV International and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Dr. Christopher Andrews unravels the complex origins of the Cold War. From the earliest days of the Bolshevik Revolution, he traces the growth of mutual distrust and fear between the Capitalist West and the world’s first Communist state - an uneasy coexistence during the inter-war years which finally ended in a complete divorce, dividing the post-war world into two camps and so threatening it with destruction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Dent, Lionheart TV International and BBC
